</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns current timeout of the given trigger or -1 if countdown is not in progress. 

<template lineStart="1"><title>Important </title><part><name index="1"/><value> The trigger could be [[local]] or remote but the result returned by this command will be for the current trigger timeout local to the client that executed the command. See [[createTrigger]] for more info.</value></part></template> </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[triggerTimeoutCurrent]] trigger </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> trigger: [[Object]] - trigger object </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Number]] - time remaining before trigger activation. </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[private]] _remaining = [[triggerTimeoutCurrent]] _trigger;</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value> 
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[triggerTimeout]], [[setTriggerTimeout]], [[waypointTimeoutCurrent]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value> 
</value></part></template>

<h3 style='display:none'>Notes</h3>
<dl class='command_description'>
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on November 26, 2013
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone_Kid|Killzone_Kid]]
<dd class="note">
Triggers have their own schedule. If you create a trigger with timeout and try to read [[triggerTimeoutCurrent]] immediately it will return -1. This is because the countdown will not start until the next scheduled trigger check is due, and this could take up to 0.5 seconds.


<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
